headline: Boeing, GE Aerospace Get Qatar Airways Order After Saudi AI Tech Deals
summary: Boeing  and  GE Aerospace  received a $96 billion order from Qatar Airways as President Trump looks to boost investments in defense and aircraft in the Middle East after reaching artificial intelligence and tech agreements on Tuesday.  The order, announced Wednesday, includes up to 210 American-made Boeing 787 Dreamliners and 777X aircraft and more than 400 GEnx and GE9X engines from GE Aerospace.  In separate releases, the companies said the agreement marks Boeing’s largest orders for widebody and 787 models to date, GE Aerospace’s biggest widebody engine order and Qatar Airway’s largest aircraft order in its history.

raw.headline: Boeing, GE Aerospace Get Qatar Airways Order After Saudi AI Tech Deals
raw.summary: Boeing  and  GE Aerospace  received a $96 billion order from Qatar Airways as President Trump looks to boost investments in defense and aircraft in the Middle East after reaching artificial intelligence and tech agreements on Tuesday.  The order, announced Wednesday, includes up to 210 American-made Boeing 787 Dreamliners and 777X aircraft and more than 400 GEnx and GE9X engines from GE Aerospace.  In separate releases, the companies said the agreement marks Boeing’s largest orders for widebody and 787 models to date, GE Aerospace’s biggest widebody engine order and Qatar Airway’s largest aircraft order in its history.

headline: U.S.-China Tariff Cuts: Is the 2025 Stock Market Sell-Off Officially Over?
summary: The S&P 500 is less than 1% away from returning to positive territory for the year.  Emotion impacts short-term market action, but earnings growth drives the market long term.  The broader market indexes soared on Monday, May 12, in response to news that the U.S. and China would pause their reciprocal tariffs on most goods for 90 days -- a move that built on the momentum from the trade deal framework that the U.S. and U.K. revealed at the end of last week.

headline: Mag 7 gains, fairly valued market, risk: Trading Takeaways
summary: AI chip stocks are pushing the tech rally higher, much to the benefit of the Nasdaq Composite index (^IXIC). Yahoo Finance markets reporter Josh Schafer lays out several of the session's key trading themes, including the serious upside Magnificent Seven stock — comprised of tech leaders Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — are seeing. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Bridgewater reveals its top buys and sells of Q1 in latest filing
summary: A new filing from Ray Dalio's Bridgewater Associates shows the stocks the firm bought and sold during the first quarter. Among the top stocks bought are Alibaba (BABA), Baidu (BIDU), the SPDR Gold ETF (GLD), Palo Alto Networks (PANW), and Booking (BKNG). On the other side, the firm sold stakes in Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Nvidia (NVDA), Meta Platforms (META), AppLovin (APP), and SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Alphabet (NasdaqGS:GOOGL) Partners With Illinois To Tackle Maternal Health Crisis Using AI
summary: Alphabet (NasdaqGS:GOOGL) recently partnered with Drive Health and the State of Illinois to launch the "Healthy Baby" program, aiming to improve maternal health in rural areas. While the company's stock rose 1.52% over the last month, the market trends, including the tech sector's broader positive momentum, likely influenced this uptick. Alphabet's moves, including the partnership and solid earnings reported for Q1 2025, may have aligned well with market optimism driven by easing tariffs...

headline: Google says hackers that hit UK retailers now targeting American stores
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Alphabet's Google said on Wednesday hackers responsible for paralyzing disruptions of UK retailers are turning their attention to similar companies in the United States.  Hultquist said the culprit is a group connected with "Scattered Spider," a nickname for a loosely interconnected network of hackers of varying levels of sophistication.  Scattered Spider is widely reported to have been behind the highly disruptive hack at M&S, one of the best-known British businesses, whose online operations have been frozen since April 25.

raw.headline: Google says hackers that hit UK retailers now targeting American stores
raw.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Alphabet's Google said on Wednesday hackers responsible for paralyzing disruptions of UK retailers are turning their attention to similar companies in the United States.  Hultquist said the culprit is a group connected with "Scattered Spider," a nickname for a loosely interconnected network of hackers of varying levels of sophistication.  Scattered Spider is widely reported to have been behind the highly disruptive hack at M&S, one of the best-known British businesses, whose online operations have been frozen since April 25.
